page.title: 04SCOVESTON FORT
page.content:
{Scoveston fort}was built in{1861_5. It was to be used to defend the Haven and the surrounding district from land ward and seaward attack. Of six forts approved by the Royal Commission in 1860 only Scoveston was to be built inland. Its maximum armament was 32 guns and a garrison of 128. The fort was never used for the Defence of Milford Haven, so it was one of{Palmerston's Follies,}named after the man who had them built. The fort was garrisoned until after the 1914-18 war and in World War II it was used as an ammunition store. Since 1950 the wooden buildings have rotted and are now unsafe, but the stone structure still stands firm. Its only use now is to store equipment for the{Point-to-Point Races
by Paul Evans
